Now there's a reason why I told myself why I never wanted to come back to CPK. We went here for dinner on Mother's Day knowing how busy it was. My  husband wanted to go to Cheesecake Factory as our first choice, but the 1 hour wait made us turn to CPK since it was close by. Considering it was Mother's Day, a 25 min wait wasn't too bad. However, when we were seated we just got bad service. It took awhile for our server to come by our table and when he wrote down our drinks, we didn't get them in about 5 minutes. Customers who were seated after us got their drinks before we did. Pffft.  I was waiting for our server to give us bread as they have done in the past and still nothing. I was told that we had to "ask" for bread as the servers no longer offer it. WHAT?! Although their bread isn't something special, my kids were starving and wanted something to eat while we waited for our meals. I ordered the garlic cream pasta with chicken and my husband ordered the meat lovers pizza. When we were served our food, I was a bit surprised. Seems like their servings are for kids. My 12 year old ordered the same thing I did and she was still hungry after eating her food. $13 for a small portion of pasta with little bits of chicken is expensive. Especially when you have to ask for bread!  I left the restaurant pretty disappointed. We spent $70 on food that wasn't even worth eating. I don't think I'll ever be returning to CPK and rather spend my money elsewhere.

When my bank account feels heavy and I feel like it needs to lose weight from all that money in there, this place is the place to go!  CPK is the weight watchers of bank accounts.  The food tastes great, but it's so damn expensive.  I always think of the starving children all over the world when I go to places like this where a small plate sized pizza costs $14.  We ordered: Asparagus & Arugula Salad Bbq chicken pizza Kung Pao Pasta A&A salad was small and tasted okay, but my girlfriend loves this dish for some damn reason.  It's just asparagus, arugula, Parmesan cheese, nuts, sun dried tomatoes and no chef's sweat in there because it's easy to make this!  you don't need to pay $4 for some salad that leaves a homeless man starving after he eats it.  As for the bbq chicken pizza and kung pao pasta.  Both were great.  Rich flavor and not bland at all.  The pizza had that bbq zing you expect and the pasta had that msg kick.  The kung pao pasta tastes like a high quality Chinese dish that married an Italian noodle.  I like it a lot, but not love it.   As for the service.  The guy was polite and did everything he needed to do, but was obviously computer illiterate.  He said he ran my card twice and it didn't go through, you'd think that they would punch in the number manually, but that's too much brain power required outside of cleaning tables and serving dishes.  Sorry for doing that to you buddy.  Don't want you to strain your brain.  So he comes back and tells me my card is declined.  Well if my card is declined I would have had a notification on my phone and email telling me my checking balance fell under a certain amount.  It was far from it.  I txt BAL to my mobile banking number and it tells me, "Your server is an idiot, tell him to run the card manually and don't give him a tip."  Morale of the story, don't expect your waiters to do anything beyond what they're mentally capable of doing.  I still gave him his tip, but suggest he take extra classes at the community college located near by to help him put some wrinkles on that grey matter of his.

She got our waters within a minute and was back asking if we were ready to order again. Our answer was the same: no. When our food came I wasn't impressed. The peach salad I ordered didn't taste half as good as the menu made it sound. To make matters worse - the employees were using the table behind us as a break table. Keep in mind that this was around 9pm and the restaurant was not very crowded. After about 20 min or so, she came back and said that her manager told her to get our check so she could clock out. Are you serious?? I have never had that happen to me at a restaurant especially more than an hour before closing. On top of this, both my friend and I felt like employees kept looking at us like they were ready for us to leave. This was enough to make me feel like I won't be coming back here. The mediocre food and service is not worth it in my opinion.

Two stars is probably generous considering our experience at CPK tonight. I feel a bit silly now looking back on it...all the signs that a terrible experience was about to ensue were present, I just chose to ignore them. My first tip should have been the lack of customers in the restaurant. Sure it was a Wednesday night, but it was 6:30 and the shopping center was busy. I thought maybe we lucked out and were just ahead of the evening rush. Not so much. When we walked in we were seated promptly in a booth by the bar. There were only a handful of other customers scattered throughout the restaurant.  Our server came out quickly and took our drink order. One goose martini, one Stone IPA (in a bottle with a glass, since we were informed they did not have Stone on draft), and one lemonade. After a few minutes we look over and see our server preparing the martini behind the bar. This would not be a concern if she looked as though she knew what she was doing or it was the best drink we ever had. Unfortunately, the martini came out half empty and the beer was a bottle of Stella Artois. Thankfully I caught this before the server opened it; however, upon her realizing her mistake she also realized the don't carry Stone IPA...at all. My husband settled for a Rogue and we proceeded to order.  My mother and I decided to partake in the dinner for two special, which our server was not very familiar with to say the least...even though we all had it in our menu and it was discussed with us by the hostess. The special came with an appetizer, two entrees, and dessert. We ordered spinach and artichoke dip, a BBQ chicken salad (hold the tortilla strips), a pepperoni/mushroom/sausage pizza, thin crust (hold the oregano), and hubby ordered a garlic chicken pizza separately. We would order desert after the meal.  The spinach dip came out in record time...and that was the only part of the meal this restaurant seemed to consider time sensitive. The meal itself took about a half hour (let me take this moment to remind you again how the restaurant was not busy). When our meal finally did arrive, we were short the pepperoni pizza. The kitchen staff accidentally put oregano on it and was going to remake it. The process of remaking a pizza must be cumbersome and convoluted because my husband and I were well finished with our meals before it came out. This is also after asking the server where it was a couple times, and a visit from the manager.  After awhile we asked they just box it up since everyone was finished with their food and understandably irritated by this time. The manger brought out the box, apologized again and walked away. Our server took another ten minutes to find her way back to us to see if we needed anything further. Umm yes, the dessert we are paying for. Red velvet please. After another 15 minutes the cake came out (they must have been baking it from scratch) and we paid our bill and left.  We had $7 taken off our bill. That is what CPK felt we deserved after having the worst dinner and service we have had in at least 4 years. We will not be back.  The food was good, which landed the two stars; however, the pizza they redid still had oregano on it. We didn't feel it was worth the hassle of mentioning it, nor did we feel like they would care. I feel a bit silly now looking back on it...all the signs that a terrible experience was about to ensue were present, I just chose to ignore them. My first tip should have been the lack of customers in the restaurant. Sure it was a Wednesday night, but it was 6:30 and the shopping center was busy. I thought maybe we lucked out and were just ahead of the evening rush. Not so much. When we walked in we were seated promptly in a booth by the bar. There were only a handful of other customers scattered throughout the restaurant.  Our server came out quickly and took our drink order. One goose martini, one Stone IPA (in a bottle with a glass, since we were informed they did not have Stone on draft), and one lemonade. After a few minutes we look over and see our server preparing the martini behind the bar. This would not be a concern if she looked as though she knew what she was doing or it was the best drink we ever had. Unfortunately, the martini came out half empty and the beer was a bottle of Stella Artois. Thankfully I caught this before the server opened it; however, upon her realizing her mistake she also realized the don't carry Stone IPA...at all. My husband settled for a Rogue and we proceeded to order.  My mother and I decided to partake in the dinner for two special, which our server was not very familiar with to say the least...even though we all had it in our menu and it was discussed with us by the hostess. The special came with an appetizer, two entrees, and dessert. We ordered spinach and artichoke dip, a BBQ chicken salad (hold the tortilla strips), a pepperoni/mushroom/sausage pizza, thin crust (hold the oregano), and hubby ordered a garlic chicken pizza separately. We would order desert after the meal.  The spinach dip came out in record time...and that was the only part of the meal this restaurant seemed to consider time sensitive. The meal itself took about a half hour (let me take this moment to remind you again how the restaurant was not busy). When our meal finally did arrive, we were short the pepperoni pizza. The kitchen staff accidentally put oregano on it and was going to remake it. The process of remaking a pizza must be cumbersome and convoluted because my husband and I were well finished with our meals before it came out. This is also after asking the server where it was a couple times, and a visit from the manager.  After awhile we asked they just box it up since everyone was finished with their food and understandably irritated by this time. The manger brought out the box, apologized again and walked away. Our server took another ten minutes to find her way back to us to see if we needed anything further. Umm yes, the dessert we are paying for. Red velvet please. After another 15 minutes the cake came out (they must have been baking it from scratch) and we paid our bill and left.  We had $7 taken off our bill. That is what CPK felt we deserved after having the worst dinner and service we have had in at least 4 years. We will not be back.  The food was good, which landed the two stars; however, the pizza they redid still had oregano on it. We didn't feel it was worth the hassle of mentioning it, nor did we feel like they would care.  Get your act together CPK. No wonder there was no wait for dinner.

When my bank account feels heavy and I feel like it needs to lose weight from all that money in there, this place is the place to go!  CPK is the weight watchers of bank accounts.  The food tastes great, but it's so damn expensive.  I always think of the starving children all over the world when I go to places like this where a small plate sized pizza costs $14.  We ordered: Asparagus & Arugula Salad Bbq chicken pizza Kung Pao Pasta A&A salad was small and tasted okay, but my girlfriend loves this dish for some damn reason.  It's just asparagus, arugula, Parmesan cheese, nuts, sun dried tomatoes and no chef's sweat in there because it's easy to make this!  you don't need to pay $4 for some salad that leaves a homeless man starving after he eats it.  As for the bbq chicken pizza and kung pao pasta.  Both were great.  Rich flavor and not bland at all.  The pizza had that bbq zing you expect and the pasta had that msg kick.  The kung pao pasta tastes like a high quality Chinese dish that married an Italian noodle.  I like it a lot, but not love it.   As for the service.  The guy was polite and did everything he needed to do, but was obviously computer illiterate.  He said he ran my card twice and it didn't go through, you'd think that they would punch in the number manually, but that's too much brain power required outside of cleaning tables and serving dishes.  Sorry for doing that to you buddy.  Don't want you to strain your brain.  So he comes back and tells me my card is declined.  Well if my card is declined I would have had a notification on my phone and email telling me my checking balance fell under a certain amount.  It was far from it.  I txt BAL to my mobile banking number and it tells me, "Your server is an idiot, tell him to run the card manually and don't give him a tip."  Morale of the story, don't expect your waiters to do anything beyond what they're mentally capable of doing.  I still gave him his tip, but suggest he take extra classes at the community college located near by to help him put some wrinkles on that grey matter of his.

The mushroom and spinach was my favorite. (  The mushrooms had a pleasant earthy overtone and were lightly cooked. Everything just gelled well together specifically the well cooked and seasoned spinach. ( ) I thought the fennel sausage flat bread was good, but not as balances as the mushroom one. Don't get me wrong, it looked great (See), and it tasted good, but the sausage was a little weak in flavor ans lacked that aggressive fennel flavor. ( ) It was a little spicy, as advertised, and the poblanos tasted mixed with the melted cheese. ( ) I enjoyed a warm tea with my meal, and the service provided by my server Brian was spot on. He was well mannered and had a good sense of humor. I am definitely a fan of their well priced small plates...

We loved the food, and we loved Val! (Just want to say that right off the bat in case any of the joking references below are somehow misunderstood.) My wife and I have been to CPK many times and have always been happy.  Last night, we took my mother-in-law to the Otay Ranch (Birch Road) location for the first time.  It looked busy when we arrived, but we were seated right away. Our server was Val, and she was just outstanding (and that's putting it mildly).  We had a running joke going about how awful the food was, and I even ordered the Pumpkin Pie Cheesecake for dessert "to see if it will be equally horrible."  Of course, this was just a joke -- the food was excellent!  I had Cedar Plank Salmon, which was delicious, and my mother-in-law ordered Shrimp Scampi Pizza.  My wife wanted the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine, but without the Fettuccine, since she's gluten-free.  CPK was more than happy to accommodate, and even included extra zucchini (much to my wife's delight). It was when Val came back and saw our empty plates that she quipped, "You must have hated your food," and thus began the whole "awful food" running joke that lasted through dessert.  At one point, I joked that we'd have to speak to the manager and demand a refund, and she deadpanned that she'd have to quit her job so she wouldn't have to keep feeling so bad about serving such awful food. Speaking of dessert, the Pumpkin Pie Cheesecake was awesome.  I highly recommend it. So Thank You, CPK, for a great meal.  And I would like to give an extra special Thanks and shout-out to Val, who was simply the best.  Please make sure she gets recognition for this (and you can tell her that it's coming from the "horrible food" trio -- I'm sure she'll remember us!).  We will definitely be back again for more "horrible food" (LOL).

This is my wife's and my favorite place to eat in the Eastlake area for lunch. To me that is saying a lot because Otay Ranch Center Mall as well as the surrounding area have a long list of places to dine. Been coming here for years. Every time California Pizza Kitchen has consistently brought real good service and food. Having a casual setting. They have indoor and outdoor dining. We have lately ordered the same two things to eat. The Italian chopped salad and the Meat Craver thin crust pizza. The only thing we deviated from our order is our drinks. I usually hate eating thin crust pizza. With the thin crust usually tasting like a cracker with toppings. But not here. The crust is chewing just the way I like it. With the added toppings of pepperoni, sausage, two kinds of ham and salami the Meat Craver is just great. Another thing I am not a big fan of is salads especially salads with garbanzo beans. But again, California Pizza Kitchen prepare it in a way that I truly enjoy eating it. The mustard vinaigrette dressing is tangy but not overpowering so you can taste the other elements of the salad- lettuce, turkey, salami, tomatoes, parmesan and of course garbanzo beans. The pizza and salad just go hand and hand. It's a great combo. Something we love to eat during lunch. I will also recommend their Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. I have eaten it in the past. Delicious. Again real good service. Real good food and drinks. The price to dine is fair. Overall, California Pizza Kitchen is a winner.

Somehow I never got around to reviewing this place. I know we come here at least three times a year. It's close by but what also makes it a good deal is that you can buy $100 of gift cards for $80 at Costco.  The food while not extraordinary is good and I've learned through trial and error what I should stick with. I'm a fan of their Jambalaya fettuccine. It is nicely spiced without overpowering. Generous amounts of shrimp, chicken, andouille sausage, and crayfish. I also like their roasted veggie salad. All sorts of grill type veggies. I have learned though that it is not worth (IMO) to add chicken to your salad or pasta. For the extra charge it is not worth it as the portion that comes is small. We once asked and they suggested next time to ask for a chicken breast to be served along with your pasta or salad for an extra charge. My kids like the pizzas of course but not just the plain cheese. This is one of the rare places where they have ventured and ordered say BBQ chicken pizza. Now if I could just get them to order something green on the pizza (cilantro or scallions aside) I'd be purchasing stock. My wife enjoys their lettuce wraps and the chicken tortilla soup.  Today I indulged with dessert, not a norm here. We ordered the chocolate soufflé. It was okay. It's consistency was bordering brownie like. However we also got the salted caramel pudding. We've got a winner here folks! A creamy pudding screaming CARAMEL at you with a crushed cookie bottom. I loved it.  It does get busy but service has always been friendly and attentive. Once my poor child ordered a Caesar salad (the one freaking time she did that on her own) and found some sort of beetle in it. Both server and manager apologized profusely comped the dish and offered her a replacement meal (though she was so put off she declined). I really appreciated that they focused on making sure she was good and talking to her like she was an adult.

We loved the food, and we loved Val! (Just want to say that right off the bat in case any of the joking references below are somehow misunderstood.) My wife and I have been to CPK many times and have always been happy.  Last night, we took my mother-in-law to the Otay Ranch (Birch Road) location for the first time.  It looked busy when we arrived, but we were seated right away. Our server was Val, and she was just outstanding (and that's putting it mildly).  We had a running joke going about how awful the food was, and I even ordered the Pumpkin Pie Cheesecake for dessert "to see if it will be equally horrible."  Of course, this was just a joke -- the food was excellent!  I had Cedar Plank Salmon, which was delicious, and my mother-in-law ordered Shrimp Scampi Pizza.  My wife wanted the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine, but without the Fettuccine, since she's gluten-free.  CPK was more than happy to accommodate, and even included extra zucchini (much to my wife's delight). It was when Val came back and saw our empty plates that she quipped, "You must have hated your food," and thus began the whole "awful food" running joke that lasted through dessert.  At one point, I joked that we'd have to speak to the manager and demand a refund, and she deadpanned that she'd have to quit her job so she wouldn't have to keep feeling so bad about serving such awful food. Speaking of dessert, the Pumpkin Pie Cheesecake was awesome.  I highly recommend it. So Thank You, CPK, for a great meal.  And I would like to give an extra special Thanks and shout-out to Val, who was simply the best.  Please make sure she gets recognition for this (and you can tell her that it's coming from the "horrible food" trio -- I'm sure she'll remember us!).  We will definitely be back again for more "horrible food" (LOL).

Gone here a few times over the years, and things have remained consistent.  Our latest dinner here was on a weekday, around 6:30, not busy at all and we were seated right away. Lots of tables, they can accommodate larger groups. Clean. Nice location, in front of AMC by otay ranch mall. Our service was good. We were checked on periodically. Drinks, ordering, and receiving our food was all within a good timeframe. We were given warm bread with infused olive oil while waiting.  The food...  Tortilla soup- tasted kinda more like a bean soup, a thick consistency, but with a little hint of Spanish flavor.. It was just all right... Mushroom pizza- yummy.. If you like mushrooms on your pizza, you will like this dish. The flavor is so rich. Yum! Crust was chewy and toasty, I believe their pizzas are wood fired...  Kids pizza/Alfredo- what my kids got. They're both generous portions and the pizza was basically a smaller version of their regular pizzas (prepared the same way)...  My fave think on their menu is the THAI CRUNCH salad. Edamame, chicken, crispy thin white noodles, shredded cabbage, green onions, peanuts, etc, with a sweet peanut/sesame flavor.. We always get the full (large) serving... 3 of us shared 2 large orders, we like it that much... I've tried it with and without avocado, both ways are tasty.  Not usually our first pick for going out... But it's a place we go from time to time when craving their Thai crunch salad!

I rate 5 stars from my visit on a few days back. 3rd time I've dined there but first time review. I'm a former F&B Director in San Diego and Las Vegas and have been in the business for 35 years. Trust me when I tell you that I'd recommend CPK.  It didn't hurt having a consummate professional server, Cristina, who was bright, menu knowledgeable, and flat out friendly. The other server assistant, Sonia, was very friendly, too. I started with Tortilla Soup and had a Turkey and Brie sandwich. I can tell they do many items from scratch including the honey mustard dressing which was brilliant on the sandwich. They have an open kitchen and I was able to see most of the operation. The cooks work clean, they look professional, and I saw zero health code violations which is unusual in an open kitchen. My son ordered a Hawaiian Pizza but wasn't overly satisfied with the amount of cheese on the pizza. He has eaten here more times than I and said it was different this time. Well, I didn't have to go far as I see Chef Michael table touching his guests checking on every single guests satisfaction. That is so unusual in this business and it's a thing of beauty when the Chef his making his presence known. Chef obviously knows about Guest Retention! He approached and I complimented him on his manner and then told him about the pizza. He apologized and said he'd remake it personally for my son. I was watching him and he had a smile as he remade the item from scratch! He delivered it to our table when completed and it was perfect. I don't know how long the management team has been there but it's working. The GM Jessie was also table touching which is wonderful.  Keep up the great work CPK.

Gone here a few times over the years, and things have remained consistent.  Our latest dinner here was on a weekday, around 6:30, not busy at all and we were seated right away. Lots of tables, they can accommodate larger groups. Clean. Nice location, in front of AMC by otay ranch mall. Our service was good. We were checked on periodically. Drinks, ordering, and receiving our food was all within a good timeframe. We were given warm bread with infused olive oil while waiting.  The food...  Tortilla soup- tasted kinda more like a bean soup, a thick consistency, but with a little hint of Spanish flavor.. It was just all right... Mushroom pizza- yummy.. If you like mushrooms on your pizza, you will like this dish. The flavor is so rich. Yum! Crust was chewy and toasty, I believe their pizzas are wood fired...  Kids pizza/Alfredo- what my kids got. They're both generous portions and the pizza was basically a smaller version of their regular pizzas (prepared the same way)...  My fave think on their menu is the THAI CRUNCH salad. Edamame, chicken, crispy thin white noodles, shredded cabbage, green onions, peanuts, etc, with a sweet peanut/sesame flavor.. We always get the full (large) serving... 3 of us shared 2 large orders, we like it that much... I've tried it with and without avocado, both ways are tasty.  Not usually our first pick for going out... But it's a place we go from time to time when craving their Thai crunch salad!

Unbelievable!

Since this was our first time she made some great suggestions with appetizers and desserts. She was always very attentive and had had a great attitude (wonderful customer service!!). We also ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and it wasn't bad. It was served on a thin crust pizza with light BBQ and the chicken was scattered all around. Overall a good experience and worth coming in again. We hope to get Shar next time too!!!

For a Chula Vista non-mom & pop corporate restaurant, it's a good place to go to. Convenient, accessible, close to the theaters, would make a great alternative to long waits at Cheesecake Factory or Buffalo Wild Wings (in fact, their food is much better than Buffalo Wild Wings), and a very good wine list compared to other restaurants in the Otay Ranch Town Center. We love their shaved mushroom & spinach flatbread, quinoa + arugula salad, and their chicken piccata entree. CPK's chicken piccata is the one dish I compare all other chicken piccata's to! It's very good (especially when paired with a good Chardonnay wine). Their house sourdough bread served with olive oil is also delicious. Remind your server to bring some bread over if it's not automatically offered. Our service was very good the night we had dinner. They offer a 9 oz wine serving which is a little more than 2 glasses for like $3 more (a pretty good deal)...

location: Chula Vista, San Diego, United States
review: Sometimes I forget that this "mall" has a CPK, but from time-to-time, I dine here for a specific craving: pasta. It has never occurred to me (until today) how lackluster their customer service is, which is surprising to say the least because they are not at all busy, ever. Even the host took me and boyfriend to our table in a blasé, zombie-like fashion. Despite the fact that their service has lowered over the past couple of years, their food satiates my carb desire. I think my favorite pasta is the garlic fettuccine alfredo with chicken, but I enjoy their tequila chicken fettuccine, as well as their pesto chicken penne. I do think they need to lessen on the oils, because it tends to get a little too greasy. Also, I can't forget their caesar salad, which is probably one of my favorite caesar's.  It amazes me how above average their prices are for such an average restaurant. Their price range for certain items goes hand-in-hand with The Cheesecake Factory, but these two restaurants are definitely not on par with one another.

This was the first time I have ever been to CPK. I actually have never heard of this place before, but we were given a gift card for Christmas. The staff was very friendly & we were seated pretty quickly. It seemed like it was starting to get a little busy after we arrived, so we were understanding with our server not getting to us quickly to check our drinks for refills. Her friendly & helpful attitude more than made up for it, & kept the evening pleasant. We got the spinach artichoke dip for an appetizer, along with the free bread to start with. Followed by a hand tossed margherita pizza, and hand tossed carne asada pizza, to share as a family, and a kids Hawaiian pizza & fruit for my son. Everything was so delicious and filling. Well I can only take my husband & daughter's word on the carne asada pizza since I'm allergic to onions & cilantro tastes weird to me, but they say it was delicious. We had a great experience & will definitely be back some time in the future. I wish I could remember our server's name (but I suck with names). She was so friendly & just great.

I normally LOVE cpk!!! But I went last Saturday ordered some apps and the bbq chicken pizza. Our egg rolls had hair in them and the pizza was undercooked. I don't know, mistakes happen .... I alerted our server who took away the food, she acted kind of insulted. I felt awkward bringing it up but I'm sorry I'm a germaphobe and I'm not trying to eat a pizza that the crust isn't cooked all the way through. The manager came to the table trying to be chummy with a lame excuse. He said the hair had to have been from a brush because they brush them with butter. Really? There was no butter flavor nothing ...... um. I'm not buying it. The icing on the cake was when he told me to look over at the guy at the bar who was bald and say he's the cook it couldn't be a hair..... I'm sorry but that's the bartender. I'm not a fool. I left and will never go back.
